sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 5 cm. Determine its volume in cubic centimeters.
message_2:
To determine the volume of a sphere, we use the formula:

Volume = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere.

Given that the radius of the sphere is 5 cm, we can plug this value into the formula:

Volume = (4/3)π(5)³

Volume = (4/3)π(125)

Volume = (500/3)π

Volume ≈ 523.6 cubic centimeters

Therefore, the volume of the sphere is approximately 523.6 cubic centimeters.
